fields.description:
Testing EUCA-13148 revealed that when stack resource creation fails the java stack trace is logged with the error at INFO level. This seems like a level of information for debug.

fields.summary: CFN: stack creation failures can have too much info at INFO log level

comments.body:
git branch dev-ethomas-EUCA-13157
git show 34b24581fc3418d24da49546e6739689011bfa65

There were a couple of places in StackActivityImpl.groovy that would catch all exceptions, log stack traces at error level then rethrow the exception.  These try/catch blocks were removed as they were redundant.  In addition, a couple of other places in StacyActivityImpl.groovy caught exceptions, logged stack traces at ERROR level, then threw different exceptions.  in this case, we just logged the error message at ERROR level, and logged the stack traces at DEBUG.  That fixes the particular stack trace shown in the description.

Fix Verified

(pre version bump 4.4.1 package)
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus-cloud
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.4.0
Release     : 0.25821.6.20170314gita021034.el7
